page.title: 03FLEET POND NATURE RESERVE
page.content: FLEET POND NATURE RESERVE Fleet pond is the largest{freshwater {lake}in Hampshire and is surrounded by a{nature reserve}of 133 acres to which the public are allowed access. Walking round the pond takes one and a half hours, going through pine, oak and birch woods. Some areas are boggy and walkers are advised to keep to the paths. The animal life is varied and in the heathland there are many butterflies. Amongst the{wild flowers} are wild iris, primrose, ragged robin and water-lilies. There are also many different insects living in the heather and gorse. There are fish in the pond to be caught by licensed fishermen. The pond is a favourite {beauty spot}for both the young and old of Fleet. Since 1973 it has been owned by Hart District Council.
